##Problem 1

First I will load the tidyverse
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
```

Problem 1
```{r}
problem1_df = tibble(
  norm_samp = rnorm(10),
  norm_samp_pos = norm_samp > 0,
  vec_char = c("A","B","C","D","E","F","G","H","I","J"),
  vec_factor = factor(c("purple","purple","purple","purple","blue","blue","blue",
                        "red","red","red")),
  problem1_df
)
```
Calculate Means:
```{r}
mean(pull(problem1_df, norm_samp))
```
Mean for norm_samp = -0.1230888

```{r}
mean(pull(problem1_df, norm_samp_pos))
```
Mean for norm_samp_pos = 0.4

```{r}
mean(pull(problem1_df, vec_char))
```
Cannot take the mean: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA

```{r}
mean(pull(problem1_df, vec_factor))
```
Cannot take the mean: argument is not numeric or logical: returning NA
